titles.ar: باب طَلَاقِ الْمَعْتُوهِ وَ الْمَجْنُونِ وَ طَلَاقِ وَلِيِّهِ عَنْهُ
titles.en: Chapter 51 – Divorce of the feeble-minded, and the insane, and his guardian on his behalf

titles.ar: باب فِي قَوْلِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ وَ لا تُضآرُّوهُنَّ لِتُضَيِّقُوا عَلَيْهِنَّ
titles.en: Chapter 49 – Regarding the Words of Allahazwj Mighty and Majestic [65:6] and do not injure them in order that you may discipline them

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (1/211)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ وَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ جَمِيعاً عَنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ طَلَاقِ الْغُلَامِ لَمْ يَحْتَلِمْ وَ صَدَقَتِهِ فَقَالَ إِذَا طَلَّقَ لِلسُّنَّةِ وَ وَضَعَ الصَّدَقَةَ فِي مَوْضِعِهَا وَ حَقِّهَا فَلَا بَأْسَ وَ هُوَ جَائِزٌ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, and Ali Bin Ibrahim from his father, altogether from Usman Bin Isa, from Sama’at who said,

‘I asked him<sup>asws</sup> about divorce of the young boy who has yet to bed-wet, and his charity. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘When he divorces in accordance to the Sunnah (under guidance) and places the charity in its rightful place, so there is no problem, and it is allowed’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Khalid and Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from all from ‘Uthman ibn ‘Isa from Sama‘ah who has said the following: “I once asked him (the Imam), ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the divorce of a boy who is not mature yet, and his charity. He (the Imam) said, ‘If he divorces according to Sunnah and places charity in the proper place where it rightly belongs, it is not unlawful and it is permissible.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (1/211)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْفُضَيْلِ عَنْ أَبِي الصَّبَّاحِ الْكِنَانِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Muhammad Bin al Fuzayl, from Abu Al Sabbah Al Kinany,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘A divorce of the child is not with anything’.
en.sarwar: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il from Muhammad ibn al-Fudayl from abu al-Sabbah al-Kinaniy who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that divorce of a child does not have any valid effect.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (1/211)

narrator_chain.text: حُمَيْدُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنِ ابْنِ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جَبَلَةَ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لَا يَجُوزُ طَلَاقُ الصَّبِيِّ وَ لَا السَّكْرَانِ .

en.hubeali: Humeyd Bin ziyad, from Ibn Sama’at, from Abdullah Bin Jabala, from Ali Bin Abu Hamza, from Abu Baseer,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The divorce of the child is not allowed, nor of the intoxicated ones’.
en.sarwar: 3. Humayd ibn Ziyad has narrated from ibn Sama‘ah ‘Abd Allah ibn Jabalah from Ali ibn abu Hamzah from abu Basir who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Divorce by a child and one who is drunk do not have any valid effect.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (1/211)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ عِدَّةٍ مِنْ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنِ ابْنِ بُكَيْرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: [لَا] يَجُوزُ طَلَاقُ الْغُلَامِ إِذَا كَانَ قَدْ عَقَلَ وَ وَصِيَّتُهُ وَ صَدَقَتُهُ وَ إِنْ لَمْ يَحْتَلِمْ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Muhammad Bin Al Husayn, from a number of our companions, from Ibn Bukeyr,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘A divorce of the young boy is (not) allowed even when he had intellect, and (as well as) his bequest, and his charity even if he has yet to bed-wet’.
en.sarwar: 4. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from a number of his people from ibn Bukayr who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Divorce by a child is [not] permissible if he understands as well as his will and charity and even if he does not experience wet dream.’” Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn all from ibn Faddal from ibn Bukayr from ‘Abd Allah ‘Alayhi al-Salam, a similar Hadith.

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن وآخره مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (1/212)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ جَمِيعاً عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنِ ابْنِ بُكَيْرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) مِثْلَهُ

text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ رِجَالِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ [لَا] يَجُوزُ طَلَاقُ الصَّبِيِّ إِذَا بَلَغَ عَشْرَ سِنِينَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, and Muhammad Bin Al Husayn altogether, from Ibn Fazzal, from Ibn Bukeyr,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> – similar to it’.
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from one of his men,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘A divorce of the child is (not) allowed when he is ten years old’.
en.sarwar: 5. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from certain persons of his people who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that divorce by a child is [not] permissible when he becomes ten years old.”
